sentences.en: " Thou must dwell no longer with this man,'said Hester, slowly and firmly.
sentences.cn: “ 你不能继续跟他住在一起了, ” 海丝特说, 语气徐缓而坚定.

sentences.en: A great number of water fowls dwell on the island.
But Trins had no time to dwell upon this.
sentences.cn: 不过屈丽娜没工夫来多想这件事.

sentences.en: He preferred to dwell upon the recognized barriers between them.
sentences.cn: 他还是宁愿把他们两个之间共同承认的障碍谈一谈.

sentences.en: His mind now tended continually to dwell on that.
sentences.cn: 他这时心里就总是在这方面打转.

sentences.en: I shut out the memory which was too painful to dwell on.
sentences.cn: 我不再去回忆那些痛苦不堪的往事了。

sentences.en: I'd rather not dwell on the past.
sentences.cn: 我不想再沉湎于过去了。

sentences.en: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
sentences.cn: 沉湎于虚幻的梦想而忘记现实的生活，是毫无益处的。

sentences.en: It would be superfluous to dwell on the matter any more.
It's morbid to dwell on cemeteries and such like.
sentences.cn: 不厌其烦地谈论墓地以及诸如此类的事是一种病态.

sentences.en: Men shall dwell together in true brotherhood and goodwill and joy.
sentences.cn: 在那儿人们将象真正的兄弟一样生活在一起,相亲相爱,欢乐无穷.

sentences.en: No need to dwell on the sumptuousness of that feast.
sentences.cn: 更不用再说那肴馔之盛.

sentences.en: Reader, it is not pleasant to dwell on these details.
sentences.cn: 读者啊, 详谈这些细节可不是一件愉快的事.

sentences.en: So you made a mistake, but there's no need to dwell on it.
sentences.cn: 你是错了，不过不必老是想着这事儿。

sentences.en: Sometimes his mind would dwell on the horrors he had been through.
sentences.cn: 有时他会老是想着他所经历过的种种恐怖.

sentences.en: They are concerned for the fate of the forest and the Indians who dwell in it.
sentences.cn: 他们为这片森林及居住于其中的印第安人的命运而担心。

trans.tran_cn: 居住，栖身，沉湎于，唠叨（尤指令人不快的事）
trans.tran_en: to live in a particular place
to live in a particular place
